Financial Management (RETO)

This module seeks to introduce students to the idea of organisations requiring to maximise their performance through a range of financial and Human Resource processes. The strategic issues which organisations have to make decisions about will be introduced, namely managing stakeholders, development via people growth, drivers and approaches to change and managing turnaround

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Demonstrate understanding of key theories which underpin effective human behaviour in the workplace and how they are applied (analysis, knowledge & understanding)

+  Identify and apply long-term sources and short-term source of finance (application, knowledge & understanding)

+  Apply effective human resource management techniques in the processes of employee resourcing, employee development and performance management (application, knowledge & understanding)

+  Apply key concepts to demonstrate how organisations are financed, how budgets are established and controlled and how financial information is analysed and interpreted. (analysis, application, knowledge & understanding)

+  To apply theories of resourcing to different scenarios and present the analysis using an effective reporting medium (analysis, application)
